intro: Campylospermum schoenleinianum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain smooth, dark brown seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
